title: London/South Kensington-Chelsea
name: Kensington Roof Gardens
directions: entrance in Derry Street, off Kensington High Street just next to High Street Kensington station
hours: 09:00â€“17:00 (but call ahead as they are sometimes closed for private functions)
content: High above High Street Kensington is an unlikely place to find ornamental gardens.  Nevertheless, three themed gardens can be found here: a Spanish Garden, a Tudor Garden and an English Woodland, covering 1.5 acres of rooftop.  They were created in the 1930s by the owners of what was then the department store underneath.  You can gaze at a stream and its resident flamingos while looking over the rooftops of Kensington.  A restaurant and nightclub can also be found up here.
